Key Match Events: Uruguay beat Canada on penalties in the third-place play-off of the Copa America
Canada's Ismael Kone and Alphonso Davies missed their penalties
Uruguay's Federico Valverde, Rodrigo Bentancur, Giorgian de Arrascaeta and Luis Suarez all converted their attempts past Canada goalkeeper Dayne St. Clair
Pre-Game Insights: Canada boss Jesse Marsch praised the performance of his side against Uruguay
Uruguay boss Marcelo Bielsa thought his side's performance should have been better
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch hailed his Canada side's potential as they build to the 2026 World Cup
Marcelo Bielsa was grateful for a victory after the disheartening semi-final loss to Colombia
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada will co-host the 2026 World Cup alongside Mexico and the United States
Defending champions Argentina will take on Colombia at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens on Sunday to decide the title
Uruguay's victory means they will pass Argentina as the most successful Copa America side - both are tied for 15 titles
